meanings.definition: Tending to evaporate or cause evaporation.
meanings.sent1: The hot sun made the puddle evaporative quickly.
meanings.sent2: The evaporative nature of the lake led to a decrease in water levels.
meanings.sent3: The evaporative mist from the waterfall felt refreshing on my face.
meanings.sent4: Her evaporative tears dried up almost instantly in the heat.
meanings.sent5: The evaporative process turned the wet clothes into dry ones in no time.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the process of evaporation.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the evaporative properties of different liquids.
meanings.sent2: Evaporative cooling systems are commonly used in hot climates.
meanings.sent3: The evaporative dance of the steam above the pot was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent4: The evaporative effect of the heat made the water disappear into thin air.
meanings.sent5: The evaporative rate of the liquid was measured to understand its behavior.
